intro: Campanula spatulata var. filicaulis, commonly known as the broad-leaf bellflower, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to parts of Europe and western Asia. It is characterized by its broad, ovate leaves and clusters of bell-shaped blue to violet flowers. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm and prefers well-drained, loamy soils in full sun to partial shade. Its foliage is often described as lush and ornamental, making it a popular choice for garden borders and rock gardens. The species is noted for its resilience and ability to thrive in a variety of garden conditions.
